topic.title: ArchiveTeam need your help
topic.body:
ArchiveTeam mission: download the data of shutdown-in-progress websites, preserve the Internet history from lost.

You can run a warrior to help:
```sh
docker run --detach --publish 8001:8001 \
  --env DOWNLOADER="zeronet" \
  --env SELECTED_PROJECT="auto" \
  --env CONCURRENT_ITEMS="6" \
  --env SHARED_RSYNC_THREADS="10" \
  archiveteam/warrior-dockerfile
```

New user of DigitalOcean can get $100 free credit, which is enough to run many warriors:
https://gist.github.com/0polar/0bf2fdad524a0b582e0806c28da8c97c

Read more:
- https://archiveteam.org/
- https://www.reddit.com/r/DataHoarder/comments/b69d1b/google_is_shutting_down_in_just_a_few_days_april/

> [thread on ZeroMe](/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/12h51ug6CcntU2aiBjhP8Ns2e5VypbWWtv/17husSAraRRvc7qRWxwA7KF7PTwjhTmxhD/1553950904)

topic.title: ZombieLoad - microarchitectural data sampling (MDS) vulnerability of Intel chips
topic.body:
**Yet another** great failure of modern computer architecture :(

https://zombieloadattack.com/

1553950519_17husSAraRRvc7qRWxwA7KF7PTwjh.body:
> [quantumworld](#comment_346_1AdWXZdPUimpXoGNXUBde2CHR7gLf4onxE): it was pure evil or they would not have been pushing it so hard
Having said that, but people still leave _1 PB_ data on G+.

> [leftside](#comment_697_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm): ipfs is talking the lead in the decentralized web devs??

Read more:
- http://archiveteam.org/index.php?title=INTERNETARCHIVE.BAK
- http://iabak.archiveteam.org/
- https://www.archiveteam.org/index.php?title=Valhalla

1556958282_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJV.body:
> [h3bhkj5gqz4n3pjm](#comment_119_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc37yo11): Tor-browser but also the other versions of firefox, are full of stuff THAT GOES AGAINST SAFETY BY DEFAULTif NO CHANGES are made TO THE REGISTRY (editable on about:config): [...]

All GUI browser are bloat, bloat = potential vulnerability.

1556988115_15APSXZVkiBzo4HXmUkCmLkMeXV7y.body: Software performance. Current implementation is not enough for c10k.

> [subxero](#comment_2_15APSXZVkiBzo4HXmUkCmLkMeXV7yBJ2VL): Ah, is that 10k hosting the same website?

No. I mean one node hosts 10k sites.

1562405706_1JcHMiQxXHX9q3ZK2LF9rZjvg3MUt.body: Rewriting whole ZeroNet client **and** keep compatibility is more hard than you think. Good luck.

> [blurhy](#comment_250_1JcHMiQxXHX9q3ZK2LF9rZjvg3MUtTpcK): atheist

LOL you have a typo too.

1562198429_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body: Any problem with Tor Browser? I think this is the only answer.
Pale Moon inherit most spirit of old Firefox, but their developer have some paranoia.

> [mozilla](#comment_3_1CkhdKhyEwqcihKX5dXe1mchYpLcvpYpiA): They try, like Google, to have a finger in every pie. They offer a free MitM service, a free DNS service, a free VPN service, a free CDN service, a free IPFS service, what could possibly go wrong lol.

And a free onion hidden service.

They handle (read: **intercept**) 10% traffic of whole the Internet.

> [filips](#comment_81_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): some websites are already blocking non-Chromium or even non-Chrome browsers.

Chrome is new IE. Electron is new Flash.
